value.title: DAX Fridays! #9: RANKX DAX Function
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the DAX RANKX() function to arrange your data based on criteria that you specify.  Keynotes: 00:00 Intro 03:00 Rankx on categories 03:17 Rankx ascending or descending 03:35 Rankx with allselected  05:28 Rank with blanks 05:28 07:26 Rank on products 07:26 10:50  Rank with column 10:50

value.title: Power BI Shows Incorrect Measure Total? How to fix it?
value.excerpt: During this session, we will try to resolve one of the most common issues that occur in Power BI Desktop which is Incorrect Measure Total issue for table or matrix visual. Sometimes, we have multiple tables in our report and we have prepared some DAX expression to calculate some values in our report.

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: Creating a Table in Power BI Using DAX Table Constructor
value.excerpt: There are some functions in DAX that are useful in very specific scenarios. For example, sometimes, you might want to create a table entirely in DAX. value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #118: Get selected or multiple values from slicers using DAX

The performance of EARLIER might be slow because it theoretically, it might have to perform a number of operations
